title.narrative: Life-saving interventions to reduce preventable mortality and morbidity among pregnant women in the drought affected counties of three provinces of DPR Korea.

description.narrative: The objective of the UNFPA project is to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality and morbidity by providing life-saving emergency reproductive health services to pregnant women in 23 drought-affected counties of North and South Hwanghae and South Pyongan provinces. In particular, UNFPA will procure and deliver clean delivery kits and clinical delivery assistance kits benefiting some 6,000 pregnant women and maternity packs benefiting 10,600 pregnant women in their third trimester to ensure hygiene and dignity. Some 10,600 pregnant women will benefit during this six-month project.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

humanitarian-scope.narrative: KOREA, DEMOCRATIC PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF DROUGHT 2017

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Life-saving interventions to reduce preventable mortality and morbidity among pregnant women in the drought affected counties of three provinces of DPR Korea.

title.narrative: RESIDENT / HUMANITARIAN COORDINATOR REPORT ON THE USE OF CERF FUNDS KOREA, DEMOCRATIC PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF RAPID RESPONSE DROUGHT 2017

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
